qas.question: What instrument does the mandolin share the same tuning of?
Where was the mandolin primarily used?
When was the mandolin considered a fad?
Who contributed to the idea that the mandolin was a fad?

answers.text: Giuseppe Pettine, Raffaele Calace and Silvio Ranieri

qas.question: When did the mandolin craze end?
What instrument does the mandolin not have the same tuning of?
Where wasn't the mandolin primarily used?
When was the mandolin considered more than a fad?

plausible_answers.text: Giuseppe Pettine, Raffaele Calace and Silvio Ranieri

qas.question: Who contributed to the idea that the mandolin was not just a fad?
When did the mandolin craze begin?

context: The international repertoire of music for mandolin is almost unlimited, and musicians use it to play various types of music. This is especially true of <b5_0>violin<b5_0/> music, since the mandolin has the same tuning of the <a0_0>violin<a0_0/>. Following its invention and early development in Italy the mandolin spread throughout the European continent. The instrument was primarily used in a <a1_0><b6_0>classical tradition with Mandolin orchestras<b6_0/><a1_0/>, so called Estudiantinas or in Germany Zupforchestern appearing in many cities. Following this continental popularity of the mandolin family local traditions appeared outside of Europe in the Americas and in Japan. Travelling mandolin virtuosi like <a3_0><b8_0>Giuseppe Pettine, Raffaele Calace and Silvio Ranieri<b8_0/><a3_0/> contributed to the mandolin becoming a "fad" instrument in the <a2_0><b7_0>early 20th century<b7_0/><a2_0/>. This "mandolin craze" was fading by the <a4_0><b9_0>1930s<b9_0/><a4_0/>, but just as this practice was falling into disuse, the mandolin found a new niche in American country, old-time music, bluegrass and folk music. More recently, the Baroque and Classical mandolin repertory and styles have benefited from the raised awareness of and interest in Early music, with media attention to classical players such as Israeli Avi Avital, Italian Carlo Aonzo and American Joseph Brent.
